main_display: Two distinct rectangular 'objects' (Object A on left, Object B on right), each with a dynamic color fill representing its temperature and a digital temperature display (Â°C) above it. A small gap separates them. When 'Thermal Contact' is ON, a glowing, wavy heat path appears in the gap, and animated small red/orange heat particles flow from the currently hotter object towards the colder one. Colors and temperatures update continuously during heat flow.
animation_style: smooth (particles move continuously, color changes transition gradually over 300ms)
visual_metaphor: Imagine water flowing from a higher level (hotter) to a lower level (colder) until both levels are equal.
